text.description: This miserable thing was a failed attempt at the reanimation of dead flesh. Perhaps necrosis had advanced too far before the process started, or this was a wild experiment performed by one who lacked proper knowledge of the principles involved. It lumbers about aimlessly with a vacant expression, which gives it something of a calm appearance - although the twitch in its clawed fingers is something to be wary of.
text.smell_message: There is a stench of decayed flesh here.

text.description: This rotting thing appears to have been brought back to life through some abominable process. It has grown sharp claws to attack with.
text.smell_message: There is a stench of decayed flesh here.

text.description: This former corpse has been granted a twisted gift of wings, resembling those of a monstrous bat. Awkward and ungainly in its newfound aerial ability, it navigates the air with unsteady movements. Despite its diminished agility and imprecise strikes, this abomination remains a formidable threat, driven by an insatiable hunger for the living.
text.smell_message: There is a stench of decayed flesh here.
text.aware_message_hidden: I hear the flapping of great wings.

text.description: A walking cadaver of towering proportions, it seems to have had the skin of countless other bodies poorly sewn over that of its own. Festering wounds on its hulk continually disgorge an acidic liquid which has bleached it beyond belief.
text.smell_message: There is a stench of decayed flesh here.

text.description: Stitched together from a grotesque patchwork of decaying flesh, this enormous form looms like a nightmarish sentinel. Immobilized by its own unfathomable bulk, it lies dormant, a testament to the macabre experiments that birthed it. Putrid fluids seep from its bloated mass, forming stagnant pools that emit a sickening stench of decay.
text.smell_message: There is a stench of decayed flesh here.

text.description: Major Sir Eric Moreland Clapham-Lee was once a commanding officer during the Great War. Shortly after his plane was shot down, his body was stolen. Now he roams these halls as a resurrected warrior in service of the cult, commanding a squad of undead.
text.smell_message: There is a stench of decayed flesh here.

text.description: Once an influential figure at the forefront of a prestigious institution, this fetid carcass now prowls among an army of the dead.
text.smell_message: There is a stench of decayed flesh here.

text.description: A writhing mass of crawling intestines.
A disembodied hand, crawling around frantically on its fingertips like a spider.
A particularly nasty disembodied hand, crawling around frantically on its fingertips like a spider. Beware of the Thing.
A severed head floating through the air.
text.spell_message: spews forth a litany of curses.

text.description: A fanatic cultist of the lowest rank, madly gibbering in some half-lost language. They may occasionally have learned to cast a spell or two, although never with any great skill. Therefore they tend to rely on mundane firearms to handle threats.

Beckoned by The Thousand-Faced Moon into laying its mind bare for the occult, the psyche of this hierophant was ravaged by scores of entities from fiendish realities. They had it gouge out its eyes and tongue, and left it a husk of former humanity. Now it lumbers about aimlessly, brandishing a spiked mace with which it flays itself in mockery of physical anguish.

A vile dwarfish creature, clad in coarse brown robes. It has a cruel grin on its pale face, and its eyes are gleaming with hatred. The Bog Tcher are mechanically inclined, which they put to use by crafting sadistic weapons and traps. Their favored weapon is their "spike gun", which can pin the target against solid objects for prolonged suffering.

A shrivelled hag who croaks of deviltry and possesses knowledge beyond the ken of a sane mind. She reigns over the myriad man-rat hybrids crawling within the dungeon, humoring her most cherished like a child: not once does she deny it the black blood that flows inside her veins.
text.aware_message_hidden: I hear a repulsive croaking voice.

text.description: This man-rodent beast slinks through cracks in the church's walls and pounces on its victims, raking at their flesh with its undeveloped limbs. Being the black matron's mongrel of choice, it titters senselessly whenever it feasts on her blood.

Marred by a mass of purplish cysts, the hide of this beast has been distended to absurdity, rendering it the size of a cow. It weaves webs as quickly as it strides, and its jaws are thick with rank lather.

The webs spun by this transcendental creature are not of any mundane kind - weaving, plucking, gnawing, it taps directly into the fabric of fate, making baleful arrangements according to its ulterior whims.
Ever watchful with leery eyes of insidious cunning, she fends for her brood as they stride between worlds through space and time.
A fanatic cultist of the Priest rank, madly gibbering in some half-lost language.
A fanatic cultist of the Wizard rank, madly gibbering in some half-lost language.
A fanatic cultist of the Arch Wizard rank, madly gibbering in some half-lost language.
An enormous green spider.
An enormous white spider.
An enormous red spider.
A faint shadow of a huge spider, lurking in the periphery.
A large aggressive rodent.
A large aggressive rodent.
A malformed cross of rat and man, birthed from witchcraft. It has a warped human face and vestigial hands for forepaws.
A fierce predator. It hisses menacingly, and venom drips from its fangs.
A fierce predator. It hisses menacingly, and venom drips from its fangs.
A fierce predator. It hisses menacingly, and venom drips from its fangs.

Forged from stone and soil by nefarious wizardry, it has been endowed with animation in the form of a dreadful beast. Its breath exhales an overwhelming density, a manifestation of pure weight and relentless impact.
Poured from brine and maelstrom by nefarious wizardry, it has been endowed with animation in the form of a dreadful beast. Its breath exhales the chaos of primordial waters.
Erupted from embers and ashes by nefarious wizardry, it has been endowed with animation in the form of a dreadful beast. Its breath exhales searing flames.
Rushed from storm and cloud by nefarious wizardry, it has been endowed with animation in the form of a dreadful beast. Its breath exhales bolts of lightning.

text.corpse_name_a: the corpse of Zuul the Gatekeeper
text.corpse_name_the: the corpse of Zuul the Gatekeeper
text.description: Zuul the Gatekeeper of Gozer is a demigod and minion of Gozer. It was worshiped by the Sumerians and Hittites in 6000 BC, along with Gozer.

An amalgam of crustacean, insect and fungi whose droning voice resembles a swarm of maddened hornets. It employs an irregular set of appendages as limbs and is capable of making use of advanced technology.
text.spell_message: speaks incantations in a droning voice.

text.description: Part of a higher echelon of the Mi-Go, the buzz of this creature's commanding tone dims that of its insectoid wings. A protective bio-mechanical suit is fused to its carapace.
text.spell_message: speaks incantations in a droning voice.

text.description: A marvel of biological and technological symbiosis. The Mi-Go Bio Engineer harnesses intricate anatomical knowledge to remotely mend the wounds of its kin - through an intricate network of unseen tendrils, it channels healing energies, fostering rejuvenation from a distance. Cloaked in ethereal veils, it maneuvers undetected, an invaluable asset to the covert operations of the enigmatic Mi-Go.
text.spell_message: speaks incantations in a droning voice.

text.description: The Omega Sentinel, a dreadful creation of the Mi-Go, stands as a testament to their technological mastery. Its chitinous form melds organic and mechanical elements seamlessly, emanating an aura of awe-inspiring terror. Armed with a devastating weapon, it guards the hidden operations of the Mi-Go with unwavering resolve.
text.spell_message: speaks incantations in a droning voice.

text.description: Flying polyps are a horrible elder race of half polypous, utterly alien entities. They are only partly material and have the power of aerial motion, despite the absence of wings. Their senses does not include sight, but what senses they have can penetrate all material obstructions. They are invulnerable to normal means of damage, though they can be destroyed by certain forms of electrical energy.

Flying polyps are a horrible elder race of half polypous, utterly alien entities. They are only partly material and have the power of aerial motion, despite the absence of wings. Their senses does not include sight, but what senses they have can penetrate all material obstructions. They are invulnerable to normal means of damage, though they can be destroyed by certain forms of electrical energy.

A tentacled alien creature, mysteriously floating through the air in a ghostly manner. They somehow sustain themselves on the brain activity of other beings. This will usually not kill the victim, but the experience is horrific beyond words. They only feed on sound minds however - a strange or chaotic mind will cause them great distress.
A gaunt, bipedal predator bearing canine features. Dried blood mottles its snout and its claws are filthy with sodden earth and chunks of flesh.
text.smell_message: It smells like an open grave here.

text.corpse_name_a: the corpse of Richard Upton Pickman
text.corpse_name_the: the corpse of Richard Upton Pickman
text.description: Once a renowned painter, notorious for his ability to depict hauntingly photorealistic scenes of demonic creatures. Now he himself seems to be fully transformed into the likeness of those creatures he used to portray.
text.smell_message: It smells like an open grave here.

text.description: A living shadow.
A mysterious humanoid figure stalking for prey. It is invisible to normal eyes.
A large wolf with eyes full of cunning.

Black Phillip is a malevolent goat of immense size, exuding a sinister aura. Its fur is as dark as coal, and its eyes shimmer with an eerie, otherworldly light. Despite its large size, Black Phillip's movements are quick and fluid, enabling it to lunge at its prey with deadly accuracy. The creature seems to take pleasure in using its formidable horns to bludgeon unsuspecting victims. Black Phillip is believed to be a manifestation of the devil himself.
A restless spirit.
A powerful spirit.
text.spell_message: speaks incantations in a deep hollow voice.

text.description: A nightmarish creature of humanoid shape. It has a hideous gangly physique and sickly pale skin. Its arms are as long as its body is tall, and it attacks with ripping claws. It can appear anywhere it desires at any time, and can also snatch teleporting creatures from their voyage and draw them to it.

A nightmarish creature of humanoid shape. It has a hideous gangly physique and sickly pale skin. Its arms are as long as its body is tall, and it attacks with ripping claws. It can appear anywhere it desires at any time, and can also snatch teleporting creatures from their voyage and draw them to it. This ancient individual has learned the art of spellcasting.
A vicious black bird.
text.aware_message_hidden: I hear the flapping of wings.

text.description: An unknown species, perhaps stemming from some hidden bowels of the earth. It is about as tall as a full-grown human.
text.aware_message_hidden: I hear the flapping of great wings.

text.description: An unknown species, perhaps stemming from some hidden bowels of the earth. It is about as tall as a full-grown human. Its attack drains health from the victim.
text.aware_message_hidden: I hear the flapping of great wings.

text.description: A colossal white bat, spoken of in ancient traditions as "Abaxu the Destroyer" (or a variation thereof). It has eternal life, which it sustains by feeding on other creatures - allegedly including human sacrifice. This has surely given rise to certain vampire myths over the years.
text.aware_message_hidden: I hear the flapping of great wings.

text.description: "There flapped rhythmically a horde of tame, trained, hybrid winged things... not altogether crows, nor moles, nor buzzards, nor ants, nor decomposed human beings, but something I cannot and must not recall."-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Festival".
text.aware_message_hidden: I hear the flapping of great wings.

text.description: An otherworldly life form, akin to a macroscopic amoeba. It disrupts physical space around it, likely an effect of its dissonance with any other cosmos than its own.
A huge predatory insect.
A huge swarming insect.
A mummified human being, possibly dating back millennia.
text.smell_message: There is a stench of decayed flesh here.
text.spell_message: speaks incantations in a hollow voice.

text.description: A grotesque mummified hybrid creature, with the body of a human and the head of a crocodile. It is wielding a spear.
text.smell_message: There is a stench of decayed flesh here.
text.spell_message: speaks incantations in a hollow voice.

text.description: The mummified fourth dynasty Egyptian pharaoh Khephren. How he came to dwell here is beyond anyone's guess.
text.smell_message: There is a stench of decayed flesh here.
text.spell_message: speaks incantations in a hollow voice.

text.description: The mummified sixth dynasty Egyptian pharaoh Nitokris. How she came to dwell here is beyond anyone's guess. Her name is found in the histories of Herodotus and writings of Manetho. According to the writings of the former, she took the throne by inviting her brother's murderers to a banquet. Then killed them by flooding the sealed room with the Nile.
text.smell_message: There is a stench of decayed flesh here.
text.spell_message: speaks incantations in a hollow voice.

text.corpse_name_a: a corpse of a Deep One
text.corpse_name_the: the corpse of a Deep One
text.description: A shambling thing which could be taken for a man were it not for its briny whiff and scaly skin. Slits on its neck emit a labored inflection, marking its struggle to gulp at breathable air. It hoists a rust-eaten spear and a net through which the thrashing remains of its last feast can be seen.
text.smell_message: There is a briny smell here.

text.description: A deacon for the deep-sea folk, this damnable shaman commands sorcery that backs its kin and wracks its foes. It is coated in copper scales which boast of majesty, and disdain is innate to its cold glare.
text.smell_message: There is a briny smell here.

text.description: An extremely aggressive species of great ape. Their pale skin and excellent night vision indicates that they adapted to subterranean life a very long time ago.

A small cave-dwelling humanoid. Their mouths are set with rows of serrated teeth, well-adapted for cutting through flesh. However, they are cowardly opportunistic creatures, preferring to stalk lonely prey that they perceive as an easy target - when met with violence, they will usually retreat, at least for a moment.

This sub-species has adapted to thriving in particularly deep environments where very little light reaches. They are even more fierce than their counterparts who dwell closer to the surface. Their mouths are set with rows of serrated teeth, well-adapted for cutting through flesh. However, they are cowardly opportunistic creatures, prefering to stalk lonely prey that they perceive as an easy target - when met with violence, they will usually retreat, at least for a moment.
A slithering conglomeration of carnivorous worms.
A predacious worm about the size of an adult human's arm. Its bite causes heavy disorientation in the victim.
This living fossil appears to have crept unchanged from the dawn of time through untold millions of years. Both a predator and a scavenger, it bites and tears with voracious jaws.
A spinning force of destruction.
A spinning force of fire and destruction.
A spinning force of pure energy.

A product of all that has festered in forgotten chambers for untold ages. Whether by nefarious design or as a consequence of prolonged exposure to the corruption encapsulated within the church's walls, it has stirred to life, inching towards any prey it seeks to devour. It exudes a mephitic cloud stemming from the unknown chemical processes that are constantly occurring within it. A malodorous broth of purulence bubbles about its nucleus, indicating it is ridden with disease.
text.smell_message: It smells like filth and decrepitude here.

text.description: A product of all that has festered in forgotten chambers for untold ages. Whether by nefarious design or as a consequence of prolonged exposure to the corruption encapsulated within the church's walls, it has stirred to life, inching towards any prey it seeks to devour. It exudes a mephitic cloud stemming from the unknown chemical processes that are constantly occurring within it. This species has developed a trait that allows it to mimic the colors of its surroundings, rendering it nearly invisible to its prey.
text.smell_message: It smells like filth and decrepitude here.

text.description: A product of all that has festered in forgotten chambers for untold ages. Whether by nefarious design or as a consequence of prolonged exposure to the corruption encapsulated within the church's walls, it has stirred to life, inching towards any prey it seeks to devour. It exudes a mephitic cloud stemming from the unknown chemical processes that are constantly occurring within it. The alarmingly green hue of this particular specimen indicates its utter venomousness.
text.smell_message: It smells like filth and decrepitude here.

text.description: A loathsome beast hauling around a great sagging body on strained legs. Through its translucent, stretched skin the vile content of the creature's husk is clearly visible: carrion, human remains in various states of decomposition, trash, and sewage - along with other less recognizable things. Its head droops to the ground, where a tentacled mouth devours whatever filth it happens upon. It occasionally spews forth half-solid chunks of ooze, which after fermenting in the remarkable conditions of the creature's bowels, takes on a form of life of it's own - hunting for biological matter to decompose in order to feed its creator.
text.smell_message: It smells like filth and decrepitude here.

text.description: A peculiar floating speck of strange shifting colors. It is very confusing to look at. Wherever they pass, they corrupt the environment around them. They are invulnerable to attacks from common materials like iron or steel, but can be destroyed by other forms of damage, such as fire or electricity.
The freezing radiance emanating from this dancing flame provides no sense of comfort whatsoever - gazing upon it is disturbing to the very soul, and fills one with bitter hatred.
It resembles an immense squid, with reaching, groping tentacles, and a pulpy, elongated sack of a body. Chthonians are powerful burrowers, and live for more than a thousand years.

A ropy, winged worm of vast size and vaporous composition. Brought forth from another plane of existence it drifts in endless search of sustenance, its maw hanging so agape it could swallow an ox whole.
text.aware_message_hidden: I hear the flapping of great wings.

text.description: Shifting in and out of sight, this creature resembles a piece of cloth sailing through the aether, seemingly folding time-space along with its dreamy soar. Atop its craned neck rests an oblong orb with which it conjures deadly bolts to heave onto any threat.

A vast, fully matured Khaga, the flight of this cryptic being conceals it from ordinary eyesight. It wails a disarmingly beautiful mantra which dissonates with the roar of the bolts it summons from its orb-like head.

An infernal piece of technology, seemingly designed to serve as a sort of guard. It hovers around, searching the area for interlopers to blast on sight. It appears to have some organic parts, and may even be a conscious living being.
text.aware_message_hidden: I hear a deep buzzing sound.
text.spell_message: makes buzzing sounds in peculiar frequencies.

text.description: A sickly growth thriving in damp areas. It produces toxic spores which it stores in its slimy heads.
A sickly growth thriving in damp areas. The toxic spores of this particular species are strongly hallucinogenic.
An array of writhing tentacles sprouting up from the ground.
A vaguely intelligent floating fungus-based organism. It contains a highly explosive gas and will detonate very easily, which it seems to desire.
A living incarnation of death. With its goat-like features, it is eerily similar to the imagery of Devils and Demons seen in medieval woodcuts.
text.smell_message: It smells like death here.
text.spell_message: speaks incantations in a deep hollow voice.

text.description: A gelatinous worm which contorts and mutates itself into different beings. Destroying the mutated form will revert the creature back to its original shape.

The Supreme Wizard of the Cult of Starry Wisdom. He appears incredibly old, like a hideous ancient vampire or a grim reaper. Tattered crimson robes flow from his skeletal frame, his bony fingers extends into razor sharp claws, and he has a grim expression on his face.
text.spell_message: speaks incantations in a deep hollow voice.

text.description: Balastha is an undead master of arms and warfare, bound to guard the High Priest for all eternity. He is wielding a Tommy Gun.
Uraga is an undead master of deception and assassination, bound to guard the High Priest for all eternity.
Vrka is a monstrous wolf-like creature dwelling in the High Priest's chambers, serving as a guardian.
